file_content.text: You've got the serum. Getting to the bottom of the toxic waste pit is your problem now.
So let me get this straight--you kidnapped me away from the Republic so that you could go skinny-dipping in a toxic waste pit?
Just give me my serum.
What does it matter to you?
I expect to be wearing my robes.
Not exactly.
All right, well I suppose it is none of my business.
A Sith's got to find some way to unwind.
Pretty much.
You're aware that this serum has never been tested on humans, right? I mean, it should work--
But it was designed for Colicoids.
What are you getting at?
Is that a problem?
How do you know I'm not a Colicoid?
Your point?
You let me worry about that.
That's my problem.
Look, I'm just trying to warn you.
This serum could kill you before you even begin, and it might not be the most comfortable of deaths.
That's a chance I have to take.
I'll risk it.
I appreciate it.
Give me the serum! Now!
Shut up!
All right, well, I warned you. I can't expect to change a Sith's mind.
This vial contains enough of the serum for about five doses, but I'd use it sparingly.
You'll have to fight through the main Republic base to get to the vault, but that's the least of your worries--the Colicoids around the vault are the real concern.
Enough of your warnings already!
I get it.
I'll be going now.
Goodbye.
Good riddance to you, Sith. Hope whatever you're after is worth it.
Whoa, there, Sith. Calm down. I've got your serum right here.
Now, maybe the major deserved what he got--who am I to say? But there's no reason to do anything rash.
Just give me my serum.
I'm not going to kill you.
Then cooperate.
I don't need a reason to kill you.
That won't stop me.
Look, I see where you're coming from. I do. You have big plans, and the major got in your way. Fine.
So, please don't take it the wrong way when I tell you--this plan of yours is completely insane!
It's too late to worry about that now. I need to know if it will work.
You may be right.
Shut up.
The more insane the plan, the better.
Isn't it great?
Look, go ahead--take the serum. Take it! I made it just like this datapad specified.
You're probably on the right track. The serum should give you resistance to the stuff in the blown-out vault.
But--there's also a good chance the serum will kill you. I mean, it was designed for Colicoids, not humans!
I'll consider myself warned.
That's my problem.
How do you know I'm not a Colicoid?
And?
Crazy, I say. You're crazy.
Just give me the serum. Now!
I'm running out of patience.
All right, fine!
Here you go. It's only a limited number of doses, and like I said, I'd use it sparingly if I were you.
You'll have to fight past the main Republic base to get to the vault, but seriously, whatever the Republic throws at you, the Colicoids will be worse.
You may have your freedom, doctor. Thank you.
You can go.
As promised, you may have your freedom, doctor. Thank you.
You can go.
What? You're not serious. I mean, you're Sith--you can't be serious. You'll let me go back to the Republic?
I promised, didn't I?
Yes.
I don't know. It was all kind of fuzzy... I wasn't sure you would.
I'm being very serious here.
Try me.
You're making me have second thoughts.
Don't drag this out.
Look, you know, I'll never make it out alive. So, if you're serious, you'll authorize a shuttle for me out of here.
I assure you--no tricks.
Don't worry.
Where do I sign?
Tell me what you need.
I haven't got time for this.
Hurry up.
Just let me get the transport officer on the holo here... there we go.
Doctor Tyrek! Sith! Captain Rollo at your service. What can I do for you?
I'm authorizing a shuttle for the good doctor.
Assist this man.
Yes. Right away.
Thank you, my lord. You're a strange sort of Sith, but I appreciate it.
You know, if you ever want to come over to the other side....
I'll think about it.
Thanks for the offer.
Well, thank you, anyway.
I don't think I'm ready to go that far.
Don't push it, doc.
Just get out of here!
No!
Yes, my lord. Of course!
This man is trying to defect.
We have a traitor here.
The doctor is a Republic sympathizer and war criminal.
Arrest this man.
What? No, it's not--
As you say, my lord. Deploy guards to Major Bessiker's offices immediately. We have a traitor in our midst!
I should have known better than to trust a Sith.
Get out of here, why don't you? Oh don't worry--I won't run. Where would I run to? Just go!
I've changed my mind.
You're right.
I knew you couldn't be serious. Anyway, good luck at the vault.
Goodbye.
Y--yes, my lord. Good luck.
Thanks, doctor, but you're no longer necessary.
We're done here. [Kill him]
I see. So now you want to kill me. Go ahead. I told you before, I'm not afraid to die.
I am still working on the serum. If you'd leave me alone, things might proceed more quickly.
Well, well. I should have known Bessiker wouldn't let me go without a fight.
But sending a Sith seems like a bit of overkill. Are you here to kill me, or are you going to torture me first?
Come peacefully and no one gets hurt.
Not if you cooperate.
Thanks for reminding me.
Sounds good. [Use lightning]
Aaargh!
No! No, listen--listen, I won't be scared into returning. I risked my life to come here.
Being an Imperial scientist--it's a fate worse than death.
Don't tempt me.
I risked my life to defect to the Republic. You think you can scare me into returning?
There are fates worse than death--and being an Imperial scientist is one of them.
Don't you think you're being a little dramatic?
That seems doubtful.
Stop complaining.
Watching as I make a necklace from your entrails is another.
I can think of worse.
I won't go back to that place! You don't know what it's like!
We're not expected to be men! We're machines, slaving day in and day out. No intellectual freedom, no creativity....
I'm tired of building killing machines. I want to do some good for humanity. I can't go back there.
That's not up for debate--you will go back.
Yes you can.
We'll see how you feel after this.
You asked for it. [Shock him]
Aaargh!
Damn Sith!
I can promise you, I'm not trying to build a killing machine.
I want to do good, too.
I know better than to believe the promises of a Sith.
You'll have to kill me! I'll never return to the Empire willingly!
I need you alive. [Subdue him]
I'm sorry--I promise to bring you back to the Republic when this is over.
I'll return you. [Subdue him]
Ugh!
Do this one thing for me, and I promise to get you back to the Republic.
I'll return you.
You're serious, aren't you? What kind of Sith are you, anyway?
Okay, I'll go. But I'm holding you to your promise--I can't be away from my research here for long.
We're working on a new field medical technology--nothing special, not even classified. Here, you should try one of these.
I know just when to stop.
Don't worry. [Shock him]
Aaargh!
Sith! Major Bessiker sent us in after you to collect the scientist.
Take him, but don't hurt him.
Be gentle.
Just make sure he doesn't try to run.
Keep your eye on him.
Tell the major to get him started on the serum right away.
Bessiker knows what to do.
Of course. We'll see you back at Sobrik.
I'm sorry. I'm busy right now.
